intro: Croton antanosiensis var. basaltorum, commonly known as the basalt croton, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, often colorful foliage. The plant typically features thick, waxy leaves with a variety of shapes and hues, ranging from green to deep red or purple. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its unique appearance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in tropical gardens.
